019package org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager;
020
021import com.google.gson.JsonObject;
022import io.kubernetes.client.apimachinery.GroupVersionKind;
023import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException;
024import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1ObjectMeta;
025import io.kubernetes.client.util.Watch;
026import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.options.ListOptions;
027import java.io.IOException;
028import java.time.Instant;
029import java.util.ArrayList;
030import java.util.Comparator;
031import java.util.Optional;
032import java.util.Set;
033import java.util.logging.Level;
034import java.util.stream.Collectors;
035import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.Constants.VM_OP_GROUP;
036import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.Constants.VM_OP_KIND_VM;
037import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8s;
038import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sClient;
039import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sDynamicStub;
040import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sObserver.ResponseType;
041import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sV1ConfigMapStub;
042import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sV1PodStub;
043import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sV1StatefulSetStub;
044import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmDefinition;
045import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmDefinitionModel;
046import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmDefinitionModels;
047import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmDefinitionStub;
048import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmPool;
049import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.APP_NAME;
050import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.VM_OP_NAME;
051import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.AssignVm;
052import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.ChannelManager;
053import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.GetPools;
054import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.GetVms;
055import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.GetVms.VmData;
056import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.ModifyVm;
057import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmChannel;
058import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmDefChanged;
059import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.util.GsonPtr;
060import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
061import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
062import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
063
064/**
065 * Watches for changes of VM definitions.
066 */
067@SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis", "PMD.ExcessiveImports" })
068public class VmMonitor extends
069        AbstractMonitor<VmDefinitionModel, VmDefinitionModels, VmChannel> {
070
071    private final ChannelManager<String, VmChannel, ?> channelManager;
072
073    /**
074     * Instantiates a new VM definition watcher.
075     *
076     * @param componentChannel the component channel
077     * @param channelManager the channel manager
078     */
079    public VmMonitor(Channel componentChannel,
080            ChannelManager<String, VmChannel, ?> channelManager) {
081        super(componentChannel, VmDefinitionModel.class,
082            VmDefinitionModels.class);
083        this.channelManager = channelManager;
084    }
085
086    @Override
087    protected void prepareMonitoring() throws IOException, ApiException {
088        client(new K8sClient());
089
090        // Get all our API versions
091        var ctx = K8s.context(client(), VM_OP_GROUP, "", VM_OP_KIND_VM);
092        if (ctx.isEmpty()) {
093            logger.severe(() -> "Cannot get CRD context.");
094            return;
095        }
096        context(ctx.get());
097
098        // Remove left over resources
099        purge();
100    }
101
102    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CognitiveComplexity")
103    private void purge() throws ApiException {
104        // Get existing CRs (VMs)
105        var known = K8sDynamicStub.list(client(), context(), namespace())
106            .stream().map(stub -> stub.name()).collect(Collectors.toSet());
107        ListOptions opts = new ListOptions();
108        opts.setLabelSelector(
109            "app.kubernetes.io/managed-by=" + VM_OP_NAME + ","
110                + "app.kubernetes.io/name=" + APP_NAME);
111        for (var context : Set.of(K8sV1StatefulSetStub.CONTEXT,
112            K8sV1ConfigMapStub.CONTEXT)) {
113            for (var resStub : K8sDynamicStub.list(client(), context,
114                namespace(), opts)) {
115                String instance = resStub.model()
116                    .map(m -> m.metadata().getName()).orElse("(unknown)");
117                if (!known.contains(instance)) {
118                    resStub.delete();
119                }
120            }
121        }
122    }
123
124    @Override
125    protected void handleChange(K8sClient client,
126            Watch.Response<VmDefinitionModel> response) {
127        V1ObjectMeta metadata = response.object.getMetadata();
128        VmChannel channel = channelManager.channelGet(metadata.getName());
129
130        // Get full definition and associate with channel as backup
131        var vmModel = response.object;
132        if (vmModel.data() == null) {
133            // ADDED event does not provide data, see
134            // https://github.com/kubernetes-client/java/issues/3215
135            vmModel = getModel(client, vmModel);
136        }
137        VmDefinition vmDef = null;
138        if (vmModel.data() != null) {
139            // New data, augment and save
140            vmDef = client.getJSON().getGson().fromJson(vmModel.data(),
141                VmDefinition.class);
142            addDynamicData(channel.client(), vmDef, channel.vmDefinition());
143            channel.setVmDefinition(vmDef);
144        }
145        if (vmDef == null) {
146            // Reuse cached (e.g. if deleted)
147            vmDef = channel.vmDefinition();
148        }
149        if (vmDef == null) {
150            logger.warning(() -> "Cannot get defintion for "
151                + response.object.getMetadata());
152            return;
153        }
154
155        // Create and fire changed event. Remove channel from channel
156        // manager on completion.
157        VmDefChanged chgEvt
158            = new VmDefChanged(ResponseType.valueOf(response.type),
159                channel.setGeneration(response.object.getMetadata()
160                    .getGeneration()),
161                vmDef);
162        if (ResponseType.valueOf(response.type) == ResponseType.DELETED) {
163            chgEvt = Event.onCompletion(chgEvt,
164                e -> channelManager.remove(e.vmDefinition().name()));
165        }
166        channel.pipeline().fire(chgEvt, channel);
167    }
168
169    private VmDefinitionModel getModel(K8sClient client,
170            VmDefinitionModel vmDef) {
171        try {
172            return VmDefinitionStub.get(client, context(), namespace(),
173                vmDef.metadata().getName()).model().orElse(null);
174        } catch (ApiException e) {
175            return null;
176        }
177    }
178
179    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals")
180    private void addDynamicData(K8sClient client, VmDefinition vmDef,
181            VmDefinition prevState) {
182        // Maintain (or initialize) the resetCount
183        vmDef.extra("resetCount",
184            Optional.ofNullable(prevState).map(d -> d.extra("resetCount"))
185                .orElse(0L));
186
187        // Node information
188        // Add defaults in case the VM is not running
189        vmDef.extra("nodeName", "");
190        vmDef.extra("nodeAddress", "");
191
192        // VM definition status changes before the pod terminates.
193        // This results in pod information being shown for a stopped
194        // VM which is irritating. So check condition first.
195        if (!vmDef.conditionStatus("Running").orElse(false)) {
196            return;
197        }
198        var podSearch = new ListOptions();
199        podSearch.setLabelSelector("app.kubernetes.io/name=" + APP_NAME
200            + ",app.kubernetes.io/component=" + APP_NAME
201            + ",app.kubernetes.io/instance=" + vmDef.name());
202        try {
203            var podList
204                = K8sV1PodStub.list(client, namespace(), podSearch);
205            for (var podStub : podList) {
206                var nodeName = podStub.model().get().getSpec().getNodeName();
207                vmDef.extra("nodeName", nodeName);
208                logger.fine(() -> "Added node name " + nodeName
209                    + " to VM info for " + vmDef.name());
210                @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops")
211                var addrs = new ArrayList<String>();
212                podStub.model().get().getStatus().getPodIPs().stream()
213                    .map(ip -> ip.getIp()).forEach(addrs::add);
214                vmDef.extra("nodeAddresses", addrs);
215                logger.fine(() -> "Added node addresses " + addrs
216                    + " to VM info for " + vmDef.name());
217            }
218        } catch (ApiException e) {
219            logger.log(Level.WARNING, e,
220                () -> "Cannot access node information: " + e.getMessage());
221        }
222    }
223
224    /**
225     * Returns the VM data.
226     *
227     * @param event the event
228     */
229    @Handler
230    public void onGetVms(GetVms event) {
231        event.setResult(channelManager.channels().stream()
232            .filter(c -> event.name().isEmpty()
233                || c.vmDefinition().name().equals(event.name().get()))
234            .filter(c -> event.user().isEmpty() && event.roles().isEmpty()
235                || !c.vmDefinition().permissionsFor(event.user().orElse(null),
236                    event.roles()).isEmpty())
237            .filter(c -> event.fromPool().isEmpty()
238                || c.vmDefinition().assignedFrom()
239                    .map(p -> p.equals(event.fromPool().get())).orElse(false))
240            .filter(c -> event.toUser().isEmpty()
241                || c.vmDefinition().assignedTo()
242                    .map(u -> u.equals(event.toUser().get())).orElse(false))
243            .map(c -> new VmData(c.vmDefinition(), c))
244            .toList());
245    }
246
247    /**
248     * Assign a VM if not already assigned.
249     *
250     * @param event the event
251     * @throws ApiException the api exception
252     * @throws InterruptedException 
253     */
254    @Handler
255    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops")
256    public void onAssignVm(AssignVm event)
257            throws ApiException, InterruptedException {
258        VmPool vmPool = null;
259        while (true) {
260            // Search for existing assignment.
261            var assignedVm = channelManager.channels().stream()
262                .filter(c -> c.vmDefinition().assignedFrom()
263                    .map(p -> p.equals(event.fromPool())).orElse(false))
264                .filter(c -> c.vmDefinition().assignedTo()
265                    .map(u -> u.equals(event.toUser())).orElse(false))
266                .findFirst();
267            if (assignedVm.isPresent()) {
268                var vmDef = assignedVm.get().vmDefinition();
269                event.setResult(new VmData(vmDef, assignedVm.get()));
270                return;
271            }
272
273            // Get the pool definition for retention time calculations
274            if (vmPool == null) {
275                vmPool = newEventPipeline().fire(new GetPools()
276                    .withName(event.fromPool())).get().stream().findFirst()
277                    .orElse(null);
278                if (vmPool == null) {
279                    return;
280                }
281            }
282
283            // Find available VM.
284            var pool = vmPool;
285            assignedVm = channelManager.channels().stream()
286                .filter(c -> isAssignable(pool, c.vmDefinition()))
287                .sorted(Comparator.comparing(c -> c.vmDefinition()
288                    .assignmentLastUsed().orElse(Instant.ofEpochSecond(0))))
289                .findFirst();
290
291            // None found
292            if (assignedVm.isEmpty()) {
293                return;
294            }
295
296            // Assign to user
297            var vmDef = assignedVm.get().vmDefinition();
298            var vmStub = VmDefinitionStub.get(client(),
299                new GroupVersionKind(VM_OP_GROUP, "", VM_OP_KIND_VM),
300                vmDef.namespace(), vmDef.name());
301            vmStub.updateStatus(from -> {
302                JsonObject status = from.status();
303                var assignment = GsonPtr.to(status).to("assignment");
304                assignment.set("pool", event.fromPool());
305                assignment.set("user", event.toUser());
306                assignment.set("lastUsed", Instant.now().toString());
307                return status;
308            });
309
310            // Make sure that a newly assigned VM is running.
311            fire(new ModifyVm(vmDef.name(), "state", "Running",
312                assignedVm.get()));
313        }
314    }
315
316    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.SimplifyBooleanReturns")
317    private boolean isAssignable(VmPool pool, VmDefinition vmDef) {
318        // Check if the VM is in the pool
319        if (!vmDef.pools().contains(pool.name())) {
320            return false;
321        }
322
323        // Check if the VM is not in use
324        if (vmDef.consoleConnected()) {
325            return false;
326        }
327
328        // If not assigned, it's usable
329        if (vmDef.assignedTo().isEmpty()) {
330            return true;
331        }
332
333        // Check if it is to be retained
334        if (vmDef.assignmentLastUsed()
335            .map(lu -> pool.retainUntil(lu))
336            .map(ru -> Instant.now().isBefore(ru)).orElse(false)) {
337            return false;
338        }
339
340        // Additional check in case lastUsed has not been updated
341        // by PoolMonitor#onVmDefChanged() yet ("race condition")
342        if (vmDef.condition("ConsoleConnected")
343            .map(cc -> cc.getLastTransitionTime().toInstant())
344            .map(t -> pool.retainUntil(t))
345            .map(ru -> Instant.now().isBefore(ru)).orElse(false)) {
346            return false;
347        }
348        return true;
349    }
350}
